thread.title: Royals benefit from questionable home run call
thread.title_full: Royals benefit from questionable home run call

author: USA TODAY Sports, USA TODAY
title: Royals benefit from questionable home run call
text:
Royals benefit from questionable home run call USA Today Sports 8 hrs ago by USA TODAY Sports, USA TODAY Â© Peter Aiken, USA TODAY Sports Royals benefit from questionable home run call Kansas City Royals third baseman Mike Moustakas hit a home run in Game 6 of the American League Championship Series against the Toronto Blue Jays that will be remembered for a long time.
AdChoices The homer by Moustakas, his first of this postseason, was caught by a Royals fan at the top of the right-field wall at Kauffman Stadium, bringing back memories of then 12-year old fan Jeffrey Maier, who interfered with a Derek Jeter home run ball in Game 1 of the 1996 ALCS between the New York Yankees and Baltimore Orioles.
Blue Jays right fielder Jose Bautista immediately signaled for interference. The umpires reviewed the play but determined there was not enough evidence to rule fan interference.and upheld, giving the Royals an early 2-0 lead.
Royals fan, Caleb Humphreys, a 19-year-old fan from Blue Springs, Missouri, became an instant celebrity. Humphreys kept the ball and was hounded by reporters, including Fox's Erin Andrews on the national broadcast.
